questions.question: A computer follows the input - __________ - Output cycle.
__________ refers to the set of instructions given to a computer.
The printed paper is called __________.
A _________________ is used to record different sounds into the computer.
Microsoft Windows is an example of an ______________ system.
It is used to take live photos and videos.
It looks like a television and it is also known as VDU.
It is used to project an image onto a large surface, such as a white screen or wall.
It is inside the CPU box and can store a large amount of information.
It is also known as a flash drive.
What is a CD used for?
options: It is used to play games.
It is used to store information.
It is used to record sound.
It is used to take printouts.
questions.answer: It is used to store information.

questions.question: What are speakers used for?
options: They are used to store information.
They are used to record sound.
They are used to listen to music.
They are used to play games.
questions.answer: They are used to listen to music.

questions.question: What is a printer used for?
options: It is used to take printouts.
It is used to store information.
It is used to listen to music.
It is used to record sound.
questions.answer: It is used to take printouts.

questions.question: What is a microphone used for?
options: It is used to record sound.
It is used to take printouts.
It is used to store information.
It is used to listen to music.
questions.answer: It is used to record sound.

questions.question: What is a joystick used for?
options: It is used to play games.
It is used to listen to music.
It is used to store information.
It is used to take printouts.
questions.answer: It is used to play games.

questions.question: What does a pen drive do?
options: It works when inserted into the USB port.
It is used to listen to music.
It is used to record sound.
It is used to take printouts.
questions.answer: It works when inserted into the USB port.

questions.question: What is the CPU?
options: It is the brain of the computer.
It is used to record sound.
It works when inserted into the USB port.
It is used to take printouts.
questions.answer: It is the brain of the computer.

questions.question: What type of device is a CD?
What type of device is a speaker?
What type of device is a printer?
What type of device is a microphone?
What type of device is a joystick?
What type of device is a pen drive?
What type of device is the CPU?
Explain the IPO cycle of the computer with the help of an example.
options: Input devices capture data from the user and send it to the CPU for processing. Devices such as a webcam, microphone, and scanner enable users to input different types of data like images, sound, or commands, which are then processed to produce meaningful outputs.

A computer follows the Input-Process-Output (IPO) cycle. First, input devices such as a keyboard or a mouse send data to the computer. The CPU, which acts as the brain of the computer, processes this data. Finally, the output is displayed through devices like a monitor or printed through a printer. For example, when you type a document on a keyboard (input), the CPU processes the data, and the monitor displays the typed document (output).
The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is responsible for processing the data that comes from input devices. It performs all the calculations and logical operations required by the computer.
Storage devices are used to save and store data so that it can be accessed later. Common examples of storage devices include hard disks, CDs, DVDs, and pen drives.
questions.answer: A computer follows the Input-Process-Output (IPO) cycle. First, input devices such as a keyboard or a mouse send data to the computer. The CPU, which acts as the brain of the computer, processes this data. Finally, the output is displayed through devices like a monitor or printed through a printer. For example, when you type a document on a keyboard (input), the CPU processes the data, and the monitor displays the typed document (output).

questions.question: Describe the function of input devices.
options: The CPU processes the input data and performs complex calculations. It coordinates between the input and output devices, ensuring that data flows smoothly through the system.

Software provides the instructions that tell the hardware what to do. For example, without the operating system (software), hardware devices like the keyboard and monitor would not know how to interact with the computer.

Input devices allow users to interact with the computer by providing data. Examples include the keyboard, mouse, and joystick. These devices send signals to the CPU, which processes the information. For instance, a scanner can input a picture into the computer for further processing.
Storage devices are used to save and store data so that it can be accessed later. I often use a pen drive to store files and transfer data between computers.
questions.answer: Input devices allow users to interact with the computer by providing data. Examples include the keyboard, mouse, and joystick. These devices send signals to the CPU, which processes the information. For instance, a scanner can input a picture into the computer for further processing.

questions.question: What is the function of CPU?
options: The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is responsible for processing the data that comes from input devices. It performs all the calculations and logical operations required by the computer. The CPU is considered the brain of the computer because it controls all the activities and executes instructions.
A computer follows the Input-Process-Output (IPO) cycle. Input devices such as a keyboard send data to the CPU, which processes the data.
Input devices allow users to interact with the computer by providing data. Examples include the keyboard, mouse, and joystick.
Software refers to the set of instructions given to a computer to process data and generate output.
questions.answer: The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is responsible for processing the data that comes from input devices. It performs all the calculations and logical operations required by the computer. The CPU is considered the brain of the computer because it controls all the activities and executes instructions.

questions.question: Software and Hardware are dependent on each other. Is this statement true? If yes, why?
options: Input devices allow users to interact with the computer by providing data. Examples include the keyboard, mouse, and joystick.
The CPU processes the input data and performs complex calculations. It coordinates between the input and output devices.

Yes, this statement is true. Hardware and software work together to make a computer function. Hardware refers to the physical parts of the computer, like the keyboard, monitor, and CPU. Software provides the instructions that tell the hardware what to do. For example, without the operating system (software), hardware devices like the keyboard and monitor would not know how to interact with the computer.
Storage devices are used to save and store data so that it can be accessed later. Examples include pen drives, hard disks, and CDs.
questions.answer: Yes, this statement is true. Hardware and software work together to make a computer function. Hardware refers to the physical parts of the computer, like the keyboard, monitor, and CPU. Software provides the instructions that tell the hardware what to do. For example, without the operating system (software), hardware devices like the keyboard and monitor would not know how to interact with the computer.

questions.question: What is the use of a storage device? Name a storage device that you often use.
options: The CPU is the brain of the computer. It processes data from input devices and controls the flow of information between components.

Storage devices are used to save and store data so that it can be accessed later. Common examples of storage devices include hard disks, CDs, DVDs, and pen drives. I often use a pen drive to store files and transfer data between computers.
Input devices allow users to interact with the computer by providing data. These include the keyboard, mouse, and scanner.
Software provides the set of instructions for the CPU to process data and generate meaningful output.
questions.answer: Storage devices are used to save and store data so that it can be accessed later. Common examples of storage devices include hard disks, CDs, DVDs, and pen drives. I often use a pen drive to store files and transfer data between computers.

questions.question: _______________ operating system allows only one user to log onto the computer at a time.
____________ option turns off your computer completely.
___________ stores all your deleted files and folders.
_______________ provides information about the task being done.
_______________ consists of tabs and groups.
This is a rectangular bar at the very end of the Taskbar.
Which of the following shows the live preview of open windows?
What are the little pictures of programs displayed on the desktop called?
Microsoft Windows is a ____________ operating system.
This option turns off your computer and starts it again.
Mac is an example of multi-user operating system.
GUI stands for Graphical User Interface.
Windows 10 was launched in 2018.
Clock is displayed on the right-hand side of the task bar.
Ribbon appears below the title bar and consists of tabs and groups.
You can point to the Task View button to see a live preview of its active windows. It is called Adam's Peek.
Status Bar provides the information about the task being done.
Scroll Bars appear when all the contents of a window cannot be seen at the same time.
There are three types of scroll bars: Horizontal Scroll Bar, Vertical Scroll Bar, Diagonal Scroll Bar.
Work Area is the main working space which displays whatever you do. In paint, the work area is known as drawing area.
What is the Taskbar?
options: A bar that is displayed at the bottom of the Desktop screen.
A bar that displays the name of the document and the software program.
It provides information about the task being done.
Move your mouse over any icon on the Taskbar to see its thumbnail preview.
questions.answer: A bar that is displayed at the bottom of the Desktop screen.

questions.question: What is Live Taskbar Preview?
options: Move your mouse over any icon on the Taskbar to see its thumbnail preview.
It provides information about the task being done.
A bar that is displayed at the bottom of the Desktop screen.
A bar that displays the name of the document and the software program.
questions.answer: Move your mouse over any icon on the Taskbar to see its thumbnail preview.

questions.question: What does the Status Bar do?
options: It provides information about the task being done.
Move your mouse over any icon on the Taskbar to see its thumbnail preview.
A bar that is displayed at the bottom of the Desktop screen.
A bar that displays the name of the document and the software program.
questions.answer: It provides information about the task being done.

questions.question: What does the Title Bar display?
options: A bar that displays the name of the document and the software program.
A bar that is displayed at the bottom of the Desktop screen.
Move your mouse over any icon on the Taskbar to see its thumbnail preview.
It provides information about the task being done.
questions.answer: A bar that displays the name of the document and the software program.
